article.headline: Boston U. 67, Massachusetts 65
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Art Bowers scored the go-ahead points on a three-point play with 18 seconds remaining as Massachusetts came back from a nine-point halftime deficit for a 67-65 win over Boston University on Tuesday night. Boston U. (7-3) led 65-63 with one minute to play. Bowers, who finished with 15 points, stole a pass and converted a leaner to tie the game. He was fouled on the play and made the free throw. After BU turned it over, Maurice Maxwell made one from the line with 4.4 seconds left. Boston U.'s Chaz Carr missed a 3-pointer at the buzzer. Rashaun Freeman had 25 points and 13 rebounds and Maxwell had 11 points for the Minutemen (6-3), who won their third straight and played the 2,000th game in program history. Rashad Bell led the Terriers with a game-high 27 points, nine in the second half. Etienne Brower had 15. After an early 7-7 tie, BU took control as Bell scored seven points in a 12-0 run. The Terriers led by as many as 13 (36-23) in the first half, and held a 39-30 lead at halftime. The Minutemen opened the second half with a 10-0 run to climb back into the game, led by Bowers with five points. UMass, which has now won the last seven meetings between the teams, led by as many as six in the second half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
